critique: This executive order concerns informing workers of their rights regarding union membership and dues. It mandates that government contractors post notices informing employees that they cannot be required to join a union to retain their jobs and outlining their rights regarding union dues. It also empowers the Secretary of Labor to enforce these provisions. The order revokes a previous executive order (12836) related to employee notification of rights concerning union dues. It aims to promote economy and efficiency in government procurement by ensuring workers are informed of their rights. It does not directly address immigration, federalism, national security, or social inclusion. It leans towards deregulation by limiting the power of unions and informing workers of their rights not to join or pay full dues. It expands executive power by giving the Secretary of Labor broad authority to enforce the order and issue regulations. It has a conservative ideological tilt by weakening unions.
